title: Workshop Shaco's Shaco Workshop [Champion Update Proposal]
body:
Hey G&B. I have been playing Shaco since Season 3 and I absolutely adore this champion. I made a thread pretty recently about how Shaco needs a ton of bug fixes and some QoL changes (http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/8yGGgyNw-remember-how-for-most-of-season-4-shacos-q-made-the-turret-switch-aggro-away-from-him?show=flat) and at the bottom I mentioned how I was making up a Shaco champion update. Well, this is it! 

 I've talked to multiple Shaco mains all the way from the bottom of silver to master tier about his current kit and this is the result of all their input.
 
First here is a little basic information about current Shaco. He was made in 2009 and was completely broken for the first two seasons of the game. In the beginning of Season 3 the nerfed him into the floor and he became a troll pick for a while. Some people continued to play him and make him work, me being one of those people. However his insanely outdated kit is really becoming something Riot can't just ignore any longer. At this time last year his overall win rate was about 56% averaged in from all elos. Currently he sits at a 49% win rate on average.
 
He is a giant buggy mess that hasn't been touched in ages, and he desperately needs some "modernizing". I wrote one of these last year and it had mixed results, so here is the result of feedback combined with the ideas I got from other Shaco mains.  
 
Ok now for the changes I think would make his kit less "toxic", a bit easier to get the hang of, and easier to balance.
-----
**Base Stats**
~~Health: 582 lvl 1---> 2010 lvl 18~~  Health: 590 lvl 1-->2010 lvl 18
Attack Damage: 58 lvl 1 –-> 117 lvl 18
Health Regen: 8.4 lvl 1 – 17.7       
Attack Speed: 0.694 (+0% –> 51.0%)
~~Mana: 297 lvl 1 –-> 977 lvl 18~~ Mana: 310 lvl 1-->1005 lvl 18
Armor: 24.9 lvl 1 –-> 84.4 lvl 18
Magic Resist:   32.1 lvl 1 –-> 53.4 lvl 18
Mana Regn: 7.2 lvl 1 –-> 14.8 lvl 18
Attack Range: 125 units
Movement Speed: 350
 
Slightly better health and mana, nothing too drastic here. I need to think a little more about how much I actually want to change his base stats, they aren't as important as changing his kit around a bunch but they are still relevant.
 -----
**Passive: ~~Backstab~~ The other Shiv!**
 
~~Shaco deals 20% bonus damage when striking an enemy from behind with his basic attacks or Two-Shiv Poison.~~
 
After using an ability Shaco becomes very excited and will use both of his shivs in his next attack for bonus critical strike damage. This bonus physical damage is equal to 60%/70%/80%/90%/100%/120% (at levels 1/3/6/10/13/16) of Shaco's total attack damage in addition to 30% of his total AP. When attacking a target from behind, this attack will apply all on-hits a second time and do an additional 10% damage. 


Cooldown: 3 seconds after the enhanced attack has been depleted. He can hold said attack for 3 seconds. 
 
_**Edit: I think 45%/60%/75%/90%/105%/120% is more fair. It gimps his early game in exchange for more mid game power. Less snowball potential but less reliant on snowballing. **_

I think this passive will suit him well, his current critical strike animation is him stabbing an enemy with both of his shivs and that was what inspired this new passive. I got rid of his insane damage amp because it was holding back the rest of his kit. Someone needs to think of a better name for it though. This will also make his power curve much healthier.
-----
**Q: Deceive**
 
~~Range: 400 ~~ Range: 450
~~Cost: 90 / 80 / 70 / 60 / 50 mana~~ Cost: 70 mana at all levels
Cooldown: 11 seconds
 
ACTIVE: Shaco instantly blinks to the target location and stealths for up to ~~3.5 seconds~~ 3 seconds. ~~ also causing his next basic attack within 6 seconds 5 seconds to Critical strike icon critically strike for bonus critical damage.~~~~Bonus critical damage: 140%/160%/180%/200%/220% of your Attack Damage. ~~
 
_New Effect:_ Shaco gains 15%/20%/25%/30%/35% [decaying] bonus movement speed for 1.5 seconds upon using Deceive or upon killing an enemy champion.
 
With the bonus damage after using Shaco's deceive removed, it leaves a lot of room for some improvement. I lowered the stealth duration and increased the range slightly to make positioning with Shaco a little bit easier and at the same time a little bit more important. The mana cost change was  to keep him from relying heavily upon blue buff for the first 15-20 min of the game, currently Shaco can barely afford to gank without having to recall for mana if he doesn't have a blue buff.
 
As for the new effect, this was to encourage the hit and run assassin playstyle of Shaco and to compensate a little bit for the removal of pretty much half the ability.
 -----
**W: Jack In The Box** 
Range: 425 / 300
Cost: 50 / 55 / 60 / 65 / 70 mana
Cooldown: 16 seconds
       
Active: Shaco summons a box at the target location that stealths after a ~~2-second delay~~ 1 second delay and lasts for up to ~~60 seconds~~ 60/90/120 seconds (at levels 1/11/16). If an enemy springs the trap, it opens and causes surrounding enemies to turn and flee while it attacks nearby enemies for up to ~~5 seconds.~~ 7 seconds.
 
Flee Duration: 0.5 / 0.75 / 1 / 1.25 / 1.5 seconds
~~Magic damage per attack: 35 / 50 / 65 / 80 / 95 (+ 20% AP)~~ Magic damage per attack: 50/65/80/100/120 (+10% AP) (10% bonus AD)
 
_**New Effect: Shaco can now only have a maximum of 3/4/5 boxes placed (at levels 1/11/16)**_
_**New Effect: JiTBs now take 75% reduced AoE and DoT damage during the 1 second delay before they enter stealth. **_
_**New Effect: JiTBs now take 20%/25%/30%/35%/40% reduced damage from large monsters. **_
**_New Effect: JiTBs now prioritize whoever Shaco is attacking first_**
 
This is to make boxes not completely useless for AD Shaco later into game while also not completely breaking AP Shaco.
 -----
**E: Two-Shiv Poison** 
 
Range: 625 units
Cost: 50 / 55 / 60 / 65 / 70 mana
Cooldown: 8 seconds
 
Active: Shaco throws a dagger at the target enemy, dealing magic damage and slowing them for ~~3 seconds.~~ 2 seconds.
Damage: 50 / 90 / 130 / 170 / 210 (+ 100% AP) (+ 100% bonus AD) magic damage.
 
Slow amount: 40%/45%/50%/55%/60%  [decays over 2 seconds]
 
~~Passive: While Two-Shiv Poison is not on cooldown, Shaco's basic attacks poison his targets, slowing them for 2 seconds and causing minions and monsters to occasionally miss their attacks.~~

Passive: Every 5 auto attacks Shaco's shivs blind a monster or minion causing them to miss their next attack. Attacking a target from behind builds up these stacks twice as fast.
 
~~Minion and monster miss chance: 20 / 22.5 / 25 / 27.5 / 30%~~
 
The slow change makes the slow far more potent but as a result is now a decaying slow as opposed to a perma slow and the total duration was reduced. His auto attacks no longer passively apply this slow as they currently do on live.  
 
As for the monster and minion debuff part of his passive, I made it far more reliable than the RNG based passive we have on Shaco at the moment. This change encourages Shaco to always pay attention to his positioning similarly to the way the current Shaco does. It helps keep Shaco Shaco while also modernizing him and making him healthier for the game over all.
 -----
**R: Hallucinate**
~~Range: 250 ~~ Range: 375
Cost: 100 mana
Cooldown: 100 / 90 / 80 seconds
       
~~Active: Shaco vanishes for 0.5 seconds, then creates a clone of himself that lives for up to 18 seconds and explodes upon its death, dealing magic damage to all enemies around it.~~
 
Active: Shaco vanishes for 0.5 seconds, then creates a clone of himself before reappearing a short distance away from where he was standing. His new position will be as close to your cursor as it can be, and his clone will have moved an equal distance in the opposite direction away from where Shaco was originally standing.
 
Clone stats: The clone lives up to 18 seconds and explodes upon its death, dealing magic damage to all enemies around it. When Shaco dies, his clone automatically explodes.
 
Damage: 300 / 450 / 600 (+ 100% AP) magic damage
 
 
Please give any and all feedback. I plan on posting a follow up thread soon! For the record, the only reason I didn't kill off AP Shaco was because roughly half the people I asked said I definitely shouldn't in any way and the rest said I should try to avoid it.

replies.body:
Cool ideas for Shaco! Few questions....

What do you think this new passive does for Shaco that makes him either play better/smoother or enhances his play?
What do you think the net effect of the changes here is as it pertains to his contributions to a team in the early, mid, and late game?

I'm especially interested in knowing, from a Shaco main (and other Shaco mains) specifically, what is it that Shaco should be doing (and that Shaco players want to do) in the late game that makes them and their teammates feel good about having him on the team?

I'll send one of my friends a link here next time I see him, he was one of the top Shacos NA in S4, he's sitting in Diamond right now. Anyhow,...

I feel as though Two-Shiv Poison contributes the least to his identity.  Backstab adds something to Shaco and isn't just a binary stat stick. You have to not only get to them, but get _behind_ them. With the range of Deceive, the visible smoke puff and the stealth duration being what they are, this isn't always easy. Deceive is half of what makes him the b*stard that he is early game, boxes being the other half. And of course, his infamous clone.

Really, ONLY his E doesn't really add to his identity. If I were in charge of changing Shaco, I'd take aim at that skill for something new. Worth noting that despite the fact it contributes little to his identity, it is universally maxed first for the added CC and damage. That said, it's a pretty uninteresting skill, and I wouldn't lament being rid of it.

If I were going to change his other skills, I'd keep what they do similar to what they do now, or it may start to dig into his identifying skills.

workshop shaco's changes to the boxes are also good, because it buff the power of shaco's boxes which make them good if they are only 1 and prevent the abuse of stacking boxes.

Out of all the shaco ideas ive seen over the past two days, id agree with these two posts the most. His e, is only iconic in that it prevents you from flashing away at 1 - 2 ignite ticks from death, because then his e hits you. I once killed someone on their fountain with e, because it was thrown right before the teleport went off. I could agree with that being changed, however id rather have the shaco clone be both more spread out, with you controlling which ones the real, as it makes fighting shacos easy knowing which one it will be, and allowing it to also q and e. No need for double ws, which would be nice if they prioritized hitting the one you are attacking.

Shaco is a very interesting champion.  He can be built in a variety of ways, but his job is usually to kill someone.  his kit isn't the best at killing multiple targets, but he can do it sometimes.  A fed Shaco can win a teamfight in an instant, while a behind shaco is almost useless except as an executioner, especially against tanks.  Shaco's e is basically a big Screw you to enemies, but it does make him feel playful when he does it.  The rest of his kit adds to his assassin aspect, and his clone adds to his silly/playful nature as well.  The only problem is that he can't handle late game tanks or ahead enemies with good frontlines.  One solution to this could be adding a debuff to his q that procs on the first enemy autoed that grants his teammates in a certain range more movement speed towards them for a short time, or make his e cause the target hit to deal slightly less damage.  For tanks, he could get some passive Armor pen (maybe on his JitB's autos or the clones).  Shaco as a whole isn't meant to be a team player or late game monster, but these would help him contend a bit.

Ummmm Idk if i'm just failing to understand or not, but those guys all have good teamfighting capabilities.  Rengo has his AOE and CC plus his burst and ult to go in on the backline and wipe the entire thing out.  Talon goes in, gets a kill, ults, positions behind their team and AOE hurts them all while getting a second kill, and Kha jumps in for the resets and keeps on jumping.  Shaco is a slower version of them with more escapes and more potential for play-making, at the cost of team fight capabilities.  He can do it, its just hard for him.

They are all assassins that do more or less the same thing. The only thing is that Shaco has a much smaller window to do it because he is _the least_ _mobile_ assassin with one short range gap closer and 0 ms steroids.

> [{quoted}](name=Workshop Shaco,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Fo05hqVe,comment-id=00080002000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-15T19:05:51.578+0000)

> They are all assassins that do more or less the same thing. The only thing is that Shaco has a much smaller window to do it because he is _the least_ _mobile_ assassin with one short range gap closer and 0 ms steroids.

This is true, but the other assassins you named all have teamfighting skills that are better than Shaco's (Rengar is arguable here).  Talons got AOE on his e and r, kha has his jumps and w AOE slows.  Shaco is more of a duelist assassin.  He can very easily take most people 1v1, and even 2v1 sometimes, but in large groups he is heavily reliant on confusion to win.  If the enemies are focused and know he's going to do his thing, he'll die instantaneously unless he builds tanky/bruiser, in which case he'll do little damage comparatively. Shaco's great when snowballing, or even when equal, but a behind shaco has little use except to set up box plays or help make a pick.  Shaco himself isnt likely to be able to 1v1 when behind, unlike those assassins who all have things in their kits to help with that (Kha's isolation damage, rengo's heals/roots and Talons ult are all pretty good tools in a 1v1.  Shaco has his ult, but any debuff gives him away and any ahead bursty enemies are likley to just instakill the both of them).  They may all be assassins, and share similar goals, but they do vastly different things to accomplish those goals.  Rengo's ult can be used to corral enemies into an ideal position for an ambush, Kha jumps in and flies right back out (or just all ins), Talon charges someone, blinks to his actual target and bursts them before running out with ult, but Shaco just appears in the middle of the fray and murders 1 person before trying to get out or ulting and just going in for the long haul.  When it gets harder to burst people later, Kha can still invis and leave, as can talon.  Rengo is a little less luck and so is Shaco.  Those two are similarly screwed when left standing in the middle of a fight with no outs.

That's where the Q changes I listed come in. You still need to position correctly but you have a fair bit more wiggle room.

> That's where the Q changes I listed come in. You still need to position correctly but you have a fair bit more wiggle room.

They would help, but removing the bonus damage on his q would make his burst suffer a bit.  With the new passive you defined, he'd end up with better 1v1 potential, but his assassinations would suffer, as he'd never have burst equal to or greater than his current burst.  He'd just have an easier time doing damage continuously and handle tanks and such a tad easier.  I like the speed boost on the q, but I like his current passive better.  It's thematic and easy to use with his q, which gives him wondrous burst against 1v1.  Once a bit ahead, it even allows him to 2v1 or even 3v1 with decent ease by assassinating a carry and just monging his friend.  Still, while i am opposed to the passive, I do like the q speed buff, it'd let him get out a bit easier and cause more of a distraction in team fights, disrupting enemies and whatnot.

His burst would be completely fine, the numbers on his passive actually scale to the same point as the numbers on his Q. I would rather him have more chances to get to their backline than for him to be doing almost a thousand damage more than he needs to in order to kill their carry.

> His burst would be completely fine, the numbers on his passive actually scale to the same point as the numbers on his Q. I would rather him have more chances to get to their backline than for him to be doing almost a thousand damage more than he needs to in order to kill their carry.

With his current q and passive damage stacking multiplicatively (or so i've been told), current Shaco will actually have a higher initial burst with q->auto->e (your passive puts his auto at 160% damage lv 1, his current q auto when behind a champ is 168% and his e deals 20% more fro behind, so it's not insubstantial).  While this new shavo would have more overall damage with a q->auto->e->auto, it also makes him take longer to perform his damage, allotting more time for them to react, and shaco already has issues bursting 1 target if he is forced to initiate or the enemy is on the look-out for him.  Just his q->auto->e can be long enough for them to lock you down and stomp you.  However, should a Shaco be fed, his combo practically 1 shots someone and leaves him to fight the rest of the team, which isn't too hard sometimes with his ult and boxes.  Your Shaco though will be more snowball-oriented it seems.  Able to go in, mong a squishy and speed towards the next target.  Bruiser Shaco would be a good deal stronger and his ganks would be too (for bot or counter ganks).  As to his damage being too much, well that's only if you're ahead.  If Shaco falls behind now he needs every ounce of burst to try and pick up kills, and is often forced to be clean-up crew Shaco or die trying to teamfight.  Your Shaco will still have that issue, but it does sound like he'd fare better against tanks and be able to possibly burst a bit better when behind, as it sounds like his 2nd empowered auto would really help.   Its tough to disclaim either Shaco, as yours is better sounding when behind, but also a tad more overbearing when ahead.  As is, Shaco that gets behind is in a pretty bad spot, but an even or ahead Shaco can easily stomp already, so I'm still on the fritz with some of your Shaco's kit still.

I don't like these suggested changes. workshop shaco clearly has his own view of how to play shaco and this suggestion is a linear design following that playstyle. This flat out removes lane shaco from the game by limiting his boxes and full AP shaco now has no scaling with W,  E + no backstab bonus
, with the changes to his passive AP shaco now has to dive into a fight where he usually would simply use his boxes, ult + E to hit enemy's with spells.

it's also totally broken for AD shaco (taking his crit off his Q and putting it on his passive puts it right back on his Q and his W, E and R skills, talk about broken, with the AD and AP scaling + two auto attacks hybrid shaco would be dealing twice the damage more AD shaco does now when he has either lick bane or trinity force)

If you want to work on shaco by all means but he doesn't need a rework. the only thing he's lacking is late game scaling somewhere in his kit and the AI/control of the clone needs work, that's it.

The late game scaling should help him if he's fallen behind in the match early so he's not completely useless. something akin to the changes just made to Lee Sin.

when you command your clone to attack an enemy and you lose sight of them the clone stops moving. something like an attack move to their last known location would be perfect or simply have his normal movement be an attack move command that ignores minions and prioritises champions.

additional if you could choose to detonate his clone early that may be needed but removes a level of counterplay to his ult. perhaps its too strong.

high level shaco mains don't want a rework and lower level players love him but blame his kit for failing to play him properly. no need for a rework.

The new passive was simply to retain his burst without having his Q be completely overloaded. Currently his Q is so good that most high elo Shaco (and myself for this matter) max Q at level 11 as opposed to putting another point in his ult because the burst is just more valuable. This strings from his ult being an unreliable buggy mess and his Q being half the power in his kit. I think that says enough for itself as far as the Q really needing to be nerfed so the rest of his kit could have something. 

As for how his team benefits from his new passive, currently Shaco early on is great because of his ganks but what most people don't realize is just how item reliant is. People think Shaco falls off late game, and that's not true in most elos. Shaco's 5-6 item power spiking is one of the best the game. His issue with late game is a result of his terrible mid game, where he is too squishy to skirmish or teamfight without just dying instantly and getting nothing done because he won't have enough burst to actually kill his target before he dies. This makes it hard for him to transition into the late game where he can just auto attack (literally just Q-->Auto) to kill an ADC. The changes are to make his power-curve more linear as opposed to it just being high early, then stagnant for the 20-35 min mark, and then shoot off the charts. This means his team won't have to work around having a Shaco anymore than they would have to work around having a Kha'zix or Rengar. 

As for what I think Shaco should be doing, I currently play him as both an AP support or top laner and as an AD assassin jungler. Shaco mains don't typically agree on how to play him, what runes he needs to take, what jungle routes are the best, or any of that; every Shaco main has developed their own 'Shaco Personality'. This is why I tried not to kill off AP Shaco in this rework, or make him need incredibly high amounts of AD to be relevant. We have high elo Shacos like Shaclone who goes bruiser Shaco and Pink Ward who mains AP lane Shaco; then we have idophinx3 who sat in master tier last season playing Shaco as an AD mid laner. He is incredibly diverse and I want to keep that, that's who he is. 

That being said, Shaco typically specializes in disrupting and killing the enemy backline, just like a normal assassin. Though AP Shaco plays as a "supportish assassin" according to Pink Ward, for the most part that's what he does: kill their carries. However, currently people hate Shaco all around. The enemy team doesn't want to play against one and your team doesn't want one either, heck I don't even like having Shacos on my team. People see him as a useless champion that's just annoying and something that is going to be useless after 20 min in. To be completely honest right now there isn't a reason to pick Shaco over meta junglers. 

Right now Shaco needs to be a positioning mastermind to do something a Rengar can do by pressing R from halfway across the map and then smashing his forehead into the keyboard once he gets within jumping distance. Shaco's Q range is still not even as long as flash's range so if you're not incredibly careful you're going to die before you even get close because he is hard countered by a 250 gold pink ward trinket. Basically what I'm trying to say is, trading the 20% damage amp to make him getting to do his job better will make him far more reliable and a bit more forgiving without actually making him insanely op; which is really what he needs, he won't have to be a suicide assassin that makes it 4v4 with the Q changes because he has the potential to get away now. He will be better at his job and his team can rely on him later into the game to get stuff done.

This is actually pretty true. People believe he's just strong early then weak late, but the truth about his power curve is this.


-----
**Early game**
At level one, he has a wickedly fast first buff clear speed, and most people know this. It poises him for an early game invade (That can be a waste of time if you know how to react properly).

Level two Shaco is one of the strongest level twos in the game.  Damage steroid, critical hit and CC. I only know Lee Sin and Rek'Sai are able to duel him at this stage.

Immediately at level 3 his advantage compared to other level 3 champions really isn't that great. Yes he has two-shiv poison, but often times, other champions are just starting to get there escape skills here, the enemy jungler probably had their clear speed/sustain skills chosen so they're now taking their CC/Mobility skills, and Shaco is left with a point-and-click slow. That just doesn't compare favorably. Still, pretty decent.

Right around his first back, he becomes outright weak. No, really. Try using Shaco when you've just backed, bought your jungle items but not yet bought a damage item. If the enemies were remotely competent and didn't get cheesed, you're now in a bad spot. Your ganks are,..Okay. Nothing spectacular. Your clear speeds are below average. Things start to look up a bit when you buy that first Pickaxe for the damage spike, but then you **need** to make something happen.

The last thing compromising his early game is his,...Well I'm sorry to say, his allies. If you want to just screw your Shaco over, as soon as he uses Deceive, go absolute ham. Really. Because when you do this, you make it impossible for him to 1. Get behind them for the backstab amp+deceive crit and 2. To lay down his box to cut off their escape route. Effectively this removes all of his hard CC. What's his gank, then? Basically? He Deceives in, autoattacks while orbwalking to maybe get two attacks in before throwing his shiv and walking off. That's his infamous "Early game power" when you do this. Imagine how that stacks up to other junglers.
------
**Mid Game**
Shaco's weakest point by far. He has a jungler's budget, which can be constrained even further by the competency of his enemies preventing him from getting kills. He has low income in a situation like this. What makes this worse is that he has the grocery list of an ADC. {{item:3074}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3035}} are all extremely expensive. Unless he snowballs, his end game isn't that great.
-----
**End Game**
Everyone considers this his weakest point, but I'm not among them. He can damn near instakill the ADC if he has enough items built, and he can demand tremendous levels of attention split pushing. He isn't a Vayne or a Jax, but his end game fall off is severely exaggerated, and is definitely a step up in power compared to his mid game. Half-finished expensive items with poor stats like {{item:3086}}/{{item:3093}} just aren't that intimidating, and the expensive costs greatly delay his power spikes if behind. His end game is fairly decent;  provided he reaches his end game around the time everyone else does. Backstab damage amp, Deceive damage amp, Deceive crit, his clone and so on.Alas, this often times does not happen.
